version_description:
• Support for iOS 8
• Updated Icon
Support for iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus

• Take quick actions - Archive or reply to messages directly from a notification 
• Email files from other apps - Attach photos and documents to Gmail right from your favorite apps 
• New attachment viewer - Open attachments from Gmail into any app

• Take quick actions - Archive or reply to messages directly from a notification 
• Email files from other apps - Attach photos and documents to Gmail right from your favorite apps 
• New attachment viewer - Open attachments from Gmail into any app
- Bug fixes and stability improvements
- Bug/translation fixes and performance improvements.

- Bug fixes.
- Third-party keyboards have been disabled due to crashes caused by a bug in iOS 9.
- Bug fixes and performance improvements.
- Bug fixes and performance improvements.

The Gmail you know and love, now with a fresh new look, sleeker transitions and some highly-requested features. It's a lot faster, too.
- Undo Send: prevent embarrassing mistakes 
- Search: find things faster with instant results and spelling suggestions
- Swipe to archive/delete: quickly clear out your inbox

- Search: find things faster with instant results and spelling suggestions
- Swipe to archive/delete: quickly clear out your inbox

- Swipe to archive/delete: quickly clear out your inbox

- Swipe to archive/delete: quickly clear out your inbox

The Gmail you know and love, now with a fresh new look, sleeker transitions and some highly-requested features. It's a lot faster, too.
- Undo Send: prevent embarrassing mistakes 
- Search: find things faster with instant results and spelling suggestions
- Swipe to archive/delete: quickly clear out your inbox

- Select multiple messages: tap on the sender’s profile image or icon next to the messages  
- Mark as read/unread: select the message and tap the ‘open/closed envelope’ icon in the top toolbar

The Gmail you know and love, now with a fresh new look, sleeker transitions and some highly-requested features. It's a lot faster, too.
- Undo Send: prevent embarrassing mistakes 
- Search: find things faster with instant results and spelling suggestions
- Swipe to archive/delete: quickly clear out your inbox

- Choose your favorite browser (Safari or Chrome) for opening links (in settings)
- Edit quoted content when replying to a message
- Copy/paste rich content when writing a message
- Select multiple messages: tap on the sender’s profile image or icon next to the messages
- Mark as read/unread: select the message and tap the ‘open/closed envelope’ icon in the top toolbar

- Choose your favorite browser (Safari or Chrome) for opening links (in settings)

- Copy/paste rich content when writing a message
- Select multiple messages: tap on the sender’s profile image or icon next to the messages
- Mark as read/unread: select the message and tap the ‘open/closed envelope’ icon in the top toolbar

- Hide sender images in your inbox (in settings)
- Swipe right/left to view the previous/next message
- Choose your preferred browser (Safari or Chrome) for opening links (in settings)
- Edit text in line or copy-paste content from the web while keeping the original text formatting
- Select multiple messages: tap on the sender image or checkbox next to the messages
- Mark as read/unread: select the message and tap the ‘open/closed envelope’ icon in the top toolbar

- Sent messages now include your Gmail web signature unless a mobile signature has been set up

• 3D touch - hard press on the app icon to quickly compose a message
• Sent messages now include your Gmail web signature unless a mobile signature has been set up
• Hide sender images in your inbox (in settings)
• Swipe right/left to view the previous/next message

• 3D touch - hard press on the app icon to quickly compose a message
• Sent messages now include your Gmail web signature unless a mobile signature has been set up

• Bug fixes and performance improvements.
• Notifications are automatically cleared when you open the Gmail app.
• Notifications are automatically cleared when you open the Gmail app.
• Save time with Smart Reply: Tap one of the three options to start your response -- hit send when done.
• Save time with Smart Reply: Tap one of the three options to start your response -- hit send when done.
• Save time with Smart Reply: Tap one of the three options to start your response -- hit send when done.

• Bug fixes and performance improvements.
• You can now print messages using Google Cloud Print or AirPrint.
• You can now print messages using Google Cloud Print or AirPrint.
• You can now print messages using Google Cloud Print or AirPrint.
• Gmail now supports the text size you’ve selected on your iPhone.
• Gmail now supports the text size you’ve selected on your iPhone.
• Gmail now shows a progress bar when sending from the Share Extension.
• Gmail now shows a progress bar when sending from the Share Extension.
• You can now add non-Google email accounts to the Gmail app via IMAP.
• You can now add non-Google email accounts to the Gmail app via IMAP.

• Bug fixes and performance improvements.
• You can now change your password, update your profile picture and more by visiting My Account in settings.
• You can now change your password, update your profile picture and more by visiting My Account in settings.
• You can now change your password, update your profile picture and more by visiting My Account in settings.
• You can now change your password, update your profile picture and more by visiting My Account in settings.
• Bug fixes and performance improvements.
• You can now more easily stay on top of your inbox with improved notification formatting.

• You can now use the new snooze button to put off emails that you just can’t get to right now.
• You can now send and request money as an attachment in Gmail with Google Pay. You can pay anyone with an email address.

• You can now use the new snooze button to put off emails that you just can’t get to right now.
• You can now send and request money as an attachment in Gmail with Google Pay. You can pay anyone with an email address.
• Bug fixes and performance improvements.
• Thanks for using Gmail! This release brings bug fixes that improve our product to help you get more out of your inbox.
• Bug fixes and performance improvements.
• You can now stay focused without interruption by turning on high priority notifications for your important messages.
• Thanks for using Gmail! This release brings bug fixes that improve our product to help you get more out of your inbox.
• Thanks for using Gmail! This release brings bug fixes that improve our product to help you get more out of your inbox.

This release brings enhancements that help you get more out of your inbox:

• You can now dismiss the prompts that appear to remind you to follow up on an email
• VoiceOver now announces system labels as expected
• VoiceOver now announces the correct text when editing a message

This release brings enhancements that help you get more out of your inbox:

• You can now turn conversation view off to view emails individually in your inbox
• You will now receive haptic feedback when selecting and deselecting items

This release brings enhancements that help you get more out of your inbox:

• You can now share multiple photos into Gmail
• VoiceOver now announces the correct text when turning off conversation view to view emails individually

This release brings enhancements that help you get more out of your inbox:

• VoiceOver now announces the correct text when recipient suggestions are displayed
• Search corrections are correctly displayed when conversation view is off
Sharing a file into Gmail now defaults to the most recently used account.

This release brings enhancements that help you get more out of your inbox:

• You can now see all of your emails across multiple accounts at once in the new All Inboxes view. No more switching between accounts!

This release also includes formatting fixes in vacation responder messages.

This release brings enhancements that help you get more out of your inbox:

• Now optimized for iOS 12 and iPhone XS and iPhone XS Max devices
• Get notifications grouped by account automatically
• Enable keyboard shortcuts for iPad devices
• Open Microsoft Office files without receiving an error message

This release brings fixes that help you get more out of your inbox:

• You can now swipe forward to get search suggestions when using VoiceOver for searching

This release brings enhancements that help you get more out of your inbox:

• Now optimized for iPhone XR devices

This release brings enhancements that help you get more out of your inbox:

• You can now see all of your emails across multiple accounts at once in the new All Inboxes view. No more switching between accounts!

This release also includes formatting fixes in vacation responder messages.

This release brings enhancements that help you get more out of your inbox:

• You can now see all of your emails across multiple accounts at once in the new All Inboxes view. No more switching between accounts!

This release also includes formatting fixes in vacation responder messages.

This release brings enhancements that help you get more out of your inbox:

• You can now add even more email accounts to Gmail and see all of your emails across more accounts at once in the All Inboxes view

This release brings enhancements that help you get more out of your inbox:

• You can now snooze messages even when conversation view is off

This release brings enhancements that help you get more out of your inbox:

• Now optimized for the new Apple iPad Pro

This release brings enhancements that help you get more out of your inbox:

• Images saved to the camera roll are not downsized, perfect for all the storage in your new Apple iPad Pro!
This release brings iPad fixes, so you can pick and choose snooze times that work best for you.

Welcome to the new Gmail that helps you get more done!

• You can now quickly view attachments - like photos - without opening or scrolling through the conversation. Enable this by going into Settings and choosing the Default view in “Conversation list density”

Welcome to the new Gmail that helps you get more done!

• Quickly switch accounts by tapping on your profile picture in the search bar

Welcome to the new Gmail that helps you get more done!

Swipe to snooze, swipe to archive… swipe how you want! Swoop these new swiping actions:
• Archive
• Trash
• Mark as read/unread
• Snooze
• Move to

Pro Tip: if you change your swipe settings, these actions are also available for notifications too!

Get more done with Gmail!

• You can now mark messages as important
• You can now see which messages are important to you with importance markers

Get more done with Gmail by scheduling messages to be sent later! This is a great way to remember a friend’s birthday, or even respect others’ digital wellbeing by not sending messages over the weekend.

• When composing a new message, click on the menu and choose “Schedule send” to select a date and time for the message to be sent
• You can now view messages that you have scheduled to be sent later in the “Scheduled” label
Get more done with Gmail! Now you can see incoming messages while composing a new one on iPad

Write emails faster with Smart Compose, now available in English.

From your greeting to your closing (and common phrases in between), Smart Compose gives you suggestions as you write. Powered by machine learning, Smart Compose is also getting, well, smarter. It will personalize suggestions for you, so if you prefer saying “Ahoy”, or “Ello, mate” in your greetings, Smart Compose will suggest just that.

Get more done with Gmail!

• You can now set up customized tabs like Primary, Promotions, Social and more for your inbox via the Settings screen

Get more done with Gmail!

• Send messages using the confidential mode. Confidential mode allows you to remove the option to forward, copy, download or print messages. You can also make a message expire after a set period of time to help you stay in control of your information.

You can now choose to be asked before external images are displayed automatically. To enable this for new incoming messages, go to Settings > specific account > Images and select  Ask before displaying external images.
Pro Tip (if you haven't noticed): You can now quickly switch between accounts by swiping up or down on your profile picture.
Pro Tip (if you haven't noticed): You can now quickly switch between accounts by swiping up or down on your profile picture.
You can now play audio attachments in messages after upgrading to iOS 13.
Notification badge counts now correctly reflect the number of unread messages after upgrading to iOS 13.
Sharing a file into Gmail now defaults to the most recently used account.
You can open long message threads more reliably after upgrading to iOS 13
Bug fixes and performance improvements.
“Hey Siri, send an email”. You can now add a shortcut to Siri to send an email faster.
“Hey Siri, send an email”. You can now add a shortcut to Siri to send an email faster.
“Hey Siri, send an email”. You can now add a shortcut to Siri to send an email faster.
You can now send emails more reliably after upgrading to iOS 13.
You can now send emails more reliably after upgrading to iOS 13.
You can now send emails more reliably after upgrading to iOS 13.
You can now use Meet inside Gmail if your account has been enabled for such functionality
You can now search for emails even without connection.
Pro Tip (if you haven't noticed): You can now switch between dark or light theme after upgrading to iOS 13. Or you can use the system theme set by default.
You can now quickly see who messages are sent to when viewing messages in the Sent folder.
You can now quickly see who messages are sent to when viewing messages in the Sent folder.
When using an iPad, you’re now able to multitask with Gmail and other iOS apps.
When using an iPad, you’re now able to multitask with Gmail and other iOS apps.
With the new Meet tab in Gmail, you can now easily join video meetings from your inbox.
With the new Meet tab in Gmail, you can now easily join video meetings from your inbox.
Bug fixes and performance improvements.
NEW: With iOS 14, you can now set Gmail as your default email app. Follow the in-app prompt or go to Settings > Gmail to set Gmail as Default.
NEW: With iOS 14, you can now set Gmail as your default email app. Follow the in-app prompt or go to Settings > Gmail to set Gmail as Default.
NEW: With iOS 14, you can now set Gmail as your default email app. Follow the in-app prompt or go to Settings > Gmail to set Gmail as Default.
NEW: With iOS 14, you can now set Gmail as your default email app. Follow the in-app prompt or go to Settings > Gmail to set Gmail as Default.
Thanks for using Gmail! This release brings you a new Gmail icon and bug fixes that improve our product to help you do more in one place.
Thanks for using Gmail! This release brings you a new Gmail icon and bug fixes that improve our product to help you do more in one place.
• Now, you can easily stay on top of your emails by adding the Gmail widget to your home screen.
Now, you can easily stay on top of your emails by adding the Gmail widget to your home screen.
Bug fixes and performance improvements.
Bug fixes and performance improvements.
Bug fixes and performance improvements.
Bug fixes and performance improvements.
Bug fixes and performance improvements.
Bug fixes and performance improvements.
You can now sync up to 90 days of emails to your device.
“Hey Siri, start a new meeting”. You can now add a shortcut to Siri to start a new Meet call faster!
Bug fixes and performance improvements.
Bug fixes and performance improvements.

Stay on top of the work that matters with Gmail, part of Google Workspace. With secure email as the foundation, you can also chat, make voice or video calls, and collaborate on projects with shared files and tasks — all in one place.

You now have more control over which chat notifications break through Focus. In the Settings app, choose the contacts you want notifications from when Focus is on.
